bill.title: Elections; allow additional time for candidates to qualify under certain circumstances.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Municipal Incumbent Candidate, Who Wishes To Withdraw As A Candidate, Shall File A Written Declaration To Withdraw As Candidate, No Later Than 5:00 P.m. On The Seventh Day After The Qualifying Deadline For That Office; To Provide That Any Fee Paid By Such Candidate Shall Be Retained By The Proper Executive Committee; To Require The Proper Executive Committee To Allow A Ten-day Period For A Person To Qualify As A Candidate For The Office From Which The Incumbent Withdrew; To Amend Sections 23-15-295, 23-15-299 And 23-15-977, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Regulate The Qualification For Candidacy For County, State And Judicial Offices, To Conform To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.
